证据片段: H dissolved in zirconium expands the lattice

证据片段: for hydrogen concentrations of H/Zr = 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.25, 1.5, 1.75, and 2.0

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk3
证据片段: The present investigation includes the alloying/impurity elements Sn, Nb, Cr, Fe, Ni, and O.

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk4
证据片段: Precipitation of ε- $\mathrm { Z r H } _ { 2 }$ (full occupancy of tetrahedral sites by H) results in a computed volume expansion of $1 7 . 9 ~ \%$ compared with pure $\mathscr { X }$ Zr.

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk4
证据片段: Carpenter reports a relative volume difference of $1 7 . 2 ~ \%$ between $\alpha { - } Z \mathbf { r }$ and $\delta$ hydride $\mathrm { ( Z r H _ { 1 . 6 6 } ) }$ with $a = 4 . 7 7 8 \mathring \mathrm { A }$ [4].

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk4
证据片段: Numakura et al. give a relative volume difference of $1 3 \ %$ between $\gamma$ hydride and the $\mathrm { Z r }$ metal matrix [44].

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk4
证据片段: whereas $5 0 \mathrm { p p m H }$ in solution in $\alpha { - } Z \mathbf { r }$ gives a volume change of $0 . 0 9 \%$ .

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk5
证据片段: Hence, in this case, the volume expansion caused by hydrogen in solution is almost twice the expansion as a result of hydrogen in the hydride (the amount of hydrogen in hydrides is four times the amount in solution).

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk5
证据片段: $1 \%$ volume increase, which is the expected effect because of $\delta$ -hydride to $0 . 3 3 \%$ linear increase.

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk5
证据片段: Oxidation of zirconium hydrides is strongly exothermic.

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk6
证据片段: Most alloying elements are more stable in metallic $\mathrm { Z r }$ than in hydrides, i.e., they inhibit hydride formation.

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk6
证据片段: Ni and $\mathrm { C r }$ are not strongly released until high fluence is reached.

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk7
证据片段: Calculations of formation energies of point defects show that it becomes increasingly harder to form Zr interstitials when the hydrogen content increases.

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk7
证据片段: The interstitial formation energy in ε-hydride is very high (621 kJ/mol) where only octahedral sites are available.

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk7
证据片段: That is a factor of 2 higher than in defect-free α-Zr (315 kJ/mol).

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk7
证据片段: For γ-hydride, the formation energy is between 280 kJ/mol and 470 kJ/mol depending on the hydrogen content.

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk7
证据片段: Computed interaction energies between point defects and alloying elements (see Table 2) show that all elements except O attract defects.

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk8
证据片段: SIAs in tetrahedral sites bind hydrogen by an energy between 13 and $1 8 \mathrm { k J / m o l }$

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk9
证据片段: hydrogen is more stable inside the (0001) vacancy loop than in random interstitial sites by approximately $4 0 \mathrm { k J / m o l }$ per hydrogen atom (for 10 hydrogen atoms inside the loop)

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk9
证据片段: At around $5 0 0 \mathrm { K }$ $( 2 2 7 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } )$ , the configurational entropy of H dissolved in the zirconium matrix can reach the same magnitude as the enthalpic preference for H to be trapped in vacancies and vacancy dislocations

STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk10
证据片段: The measurements were done in the temperature interval 610-870 K

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk10
STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk11
证据片段: It is found that the alloying elements reduce the diffusion barriers and lead to faster vacancy diffusion. The effect is largest for $\mathrm { C r } _ { \mathrm { \Omega } }$ followed by $\mathrm { N i }$ and Nb.

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk11
证据片段: Substitutional Sn seems to have a very small effect on the diffusion of interstitial $\mathrm { Z r }$ at high temperatures, but a retarding effect at low temperatures by repelling $\mathrm { Z r }$ interstitials.

文献ID: STP1543-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_17th Volume_008_chunk11
证据片段: Substitutional Sn seems to have a very small effect on the diffusion of interstitial $\mathrm { Z r }$ at high temperatures, but a retarding effect at low temperatures by repelling $\mathrm { Z r }$ interstitials.
